intro: Pedicularis tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is often cultivated in alpine gardens for its ornamental value.
